Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Nitish govt orders closure of shops from.description: PATNA: Worried over the death of 78 persons in last two days due to heatwave, Bihar government on Monday decided to shut down all shops and marketing complexes from 11am to 5pm in south Bihar districts. The decision was taken at a high level meeting convened by CM Nitish Kumar to review the state government’s actions taken in the cases of heat wave in south Bihar and Acute Encephalitis Syndrome deaths mainly in districts of north Bihar. Briefing media persons about the decisions taken at the meeting, state’s chief secretary Deepak Kumar said mainly three districts of south Bihar namely Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada are badly hit by the unprecedented heatwave. However, the state government has decided to regulate opening time of shops and market complexes in all districts of south Bihar. Chief secretary said, the opening and closure timings of shops and marketing complexes would be regulated by the state’s labour resources department (LRD) under the Bihar Shops and Business Establishments Act. To a question, the chief secretary said the LRD would bring out a notification specifying timing and the places to be covered under the government’s latest decision. He however, clarified that shops and marketing complexes of the state capital would not be affected by the decision. Accompanied by principal secretary (health) Sanjay Kumar, the chief secretary also said that all necessary arrangements have been made at the government hospitals in the heat affected districts to provide medical facilities to people. Principal secretary (health) Sanjay Kumar said separate wards and isolation wards have been earmarked in all health facilities in Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada districts to provide better facilities to heat affected patients. Uninterrupted electric supply was being ensured at all health facilities in the three district. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018AES death toll may surge if heatwa.description: PATNA: The death toll due to suspected Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) may go up in the days to come as there seems to be no let-up in the high temperature and humidity. The doctors attending on the affected children at the Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) are apprehending that more children may fall prey to the deadly disease if the monsoon got delayed and heatwave condition continued. Altogether 20 children died during the past 24 hours taking death toll up to 93 since January this year. Dr G S Sahni, head of the paediatrics department of the SKMCH, said the mortality rate would reduce once the rainy season starts. “But there seems to be no let-up in the high temperature coupled with humidity, which is fatal for the vulnerable kids,” he said, adding that the doctors were making all-out efforts to save the lives of the children. Muzaffarpur civil surgeon Dr SP Singh also corroborated Dr Sahni’s contention. “There will be no respite unless and until the rainy season starts,” he told this newspaper over phone from Muzaffarpur on Sunday. The normal temperature varied between 43 degrees C and 46 degrees C in the last two days. Even state health minister Mangal Pandey, who accompanied Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan to Muzaffarpur today, agreed with the two doctors’ views. The highest casualty of the children was recorded in 2012 when around 400 children had died. In 2013, the number of casualties reduced to around 350 followed by around 300 in 2014. In 2017 and 2018, the death toll was negligible. The situation became so alarming in 2014 that Dr Harsh Vardhan as the Union health minister had visited Muzaffarpur. Researches were carried out and medical experts from different places, including Atlanta, were assigned the task. However, the medical experts have so far not found the exact cause of this disease. JP Nadda.description: NEW DELHI: Ending speculation over the appointment of a working president, the BJP parliamentary board on Monday appointed former health minister and senior leader Jagat Prakash Nadda to the post even as home minister Amit Shah will continue to be party president. Nadda's appointment as working president was on the cards after he was not inducted into the government. Since Shah will need to meet his ministerial commitments, Nadda, as a full time party functionary, is expected to help him with the nitty-gritty of organisational tasks. "I am confident that under the leadership of Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and powered by the hard work of our karyakartas (workers), BJP will continue winning people's trust and serving our society. We remain committed to building a strong, developed and inclusive India," PM Modi tweeted. I am confident that under the leadership of Shri @AmitShah and Shri @JPNadda, and powered by the hardwork of our Ka… https://t.co/EyDidISB2W— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1560786282000Modi said Nadda is a diligent worker who has risen through the ranks due to his hard work and organisational skills. "Humble and affable, he is widely respected across the BJP family. Congratulations to him on becoming the working president of the party," the Prime Minister added. Announcing the decision, defence minister Rajnath Singh said, "BJP won several elections under leadership of Amit Shah. But since PM appointed him home minister, Amit Shah himself said the responsibility of party president should be given to someone else. BJP Parliamentary board has selected JP Nadda as working president." Modi and other parliamentary board members including Shah, Rajnath Singh, Union ministers Nitin Gadkari, Thawar Chand Gehlot and senior BJP leaders Sushma Swaraj, Shivraj Singh Chauhan and Ramlal greeted Nadda after his selection as party working president. Hailing from Himachal, Nadda (58) has held several organisational posts at the national and state level. This will be the first time the party has appointed a working president. After considerable discussion it was decided that Shah's continuance would be required in view of important state elections coming up and the party also announced a membership drive and organisational elections that will keep cadre busy for several months. Singh said Nadda will remain the working president till BJP's membership drive and organisational elections are over. Process of the organisational elections has already begun as state unit elections are likely next month. As per procedure, it takes four-five months to complete the entire organisational elections. Singh said the parliamentary board wanted that Shah should look after the party as president until organisational elections of the party are completed. "However, Amit Shah himself urged that as home minister, he can't do justice with responsibilities as party chief and wanted someone to take over after which the parliamentary board unanimously selected Nadda as working president," Singh said. Nadda was mentioned as a likely party chief in 2014 when Rajnath Singh resigned after joining the Union ministry. However, Shah took over as party president. Nadda has long experience of the party organisation as he was the in-charge of the party headquarters and is a popular figure. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nIPS Officers\u2019 Wives Association o.description: The IPS Officers’ Wives Association recently organised a Family Night for the officers and their better halves. The do, held at the lawns of the BMP campus, was a memorable event, with the venue being decked up in a Valentine theme with heart-shaped balloons. Upping the fashion quotient was Prity Singh Rana who looked pretty in her pink lehenga, while Poonam Thakur, president of the association, earned lots of compliments for her hairstyle and suit. “The purpose behind organising the event was to foster relationships and encourage family bonding activities,” said Poonam. “The bash gave us the opportunity to enjoy some moments of togetherness with our better halves, which we hardly enjoy because of our busy and hectic schedule,” said DGP PK Thakur. Madhurima Raj and Ratna added some spice to the evening by organising some interactive games for the guests. The paper dance had some fun moments, as the couples struggled to shake a leg on the sheet of paper given to them. Another fun-filled activity of the evening was when the husbands were asked to sing a song for their wives based on the items which they took out from a box, in which Sunit Kumar sung the song Ek Garam Chai Ki Pyaali. Later, all the guests moved to the dance floor. Kundan Krishnan and JS Gangawar were seen dancing on songs like Blue Eyes, India Waale and many more. Heatwave: Section 144 imposed in Gaya.description: PATNA: The Gaya district administration on Monday issued prohibitory order under Section 144 of CrPC in view of intense heatwave, banning all construction activities, MGNREGA work, public gatherings in open spaces and cultural shows between 11am and 4pm. Heatwave has claimed 31 lives in the district in the last three days. Gaya DM Abhishek Singh said the order would cover all government and non-government construction activities. Labour work under MGNREGA will remain suspended after 10.30am. Director of the District Rural Development Authority has been asked to enforce the order. Shopkeepers and vendors have also been asked not to open their shops between 11am and 4pm. However, emergency services have been exempted from the purview of the order, the DM said. Singh said the prohibitory order is part of preventive measures taken by the district administration to avoid casualties due to heatstroke. The district administration has advised people to take adequate precautions against heatwave and avoid being exposed in the sun for a prolonged period. The residents have been suggested to drink water properly and not to keep their stomach empty. Magadh divisional commissioner Pankaj Kumar Pal on Sunday took stock of the situation arising out of the heatwave condition in four districts of the division – Gaya, Nawada, Aurangabad and Jehanabad. As many as 30 people have so far died in Aurangabad and nine in Nawada due to heatwave. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Patnaites feel the pinch as potato and o.description: PATNA: Soaring potato and onion prices are bringing tears to the eyes of Patnaites and burning a hole in their pockets. While the price of onions in the wholesale market went up to Rs 1,400 per quintal on Sunday, that of potatoes surged from Rs 800 per quintal to Rs 1,200 per quintal in one week. According to retailers, onion prices are usually high at this time of the year because of the “lean period” before the new harvest season. On the other hand, additional storage cost is being cited as the reason for surge in potato rates. Wholesalers at Bazar Samiti and the Mithapur vegetable market claimed that onions were sold between Rs 13 and Rs 14 per kilogram on Saturday. Their cost was around Rs 11-12 per kg almost a week ago. Similarly, the price of white potatoes was Rs 11-Rs 12 per kg on Saturday, while it was Rs 10.5-Rs 11 per kg a week ago. The rate of red potatoes also surged from Rs 12.5 to Rs 13 in one week. Praveen Kumar, a wholesaler at Kankarbagh said, “Potatoes are required to be put in cold storage during the monsoon and pre-monsoon periods as they may get ripe if stored at normal temperature. The daily cost of cold storage of potatoes is Rs 200-250 per quintal. We, therefore, have to increase the prices accordingly.” Patnaites, on the contrary, are feeling the pinch as onions and potatoes are part of most Indian meals. Homemaker Anita Singh told this newspaper, “Onions and potatoes are important ingredients. Rise in their prices is a burden on us.” 46-year-old Abhijeet Kumar Singh rued, “We are middle-class people. How will we manage to buy such expensive vegetables?” Vinit Kumar, who owns a ‘pani puri’ stall in Kurji, said, “Selling ‘pani puri’ is my only source of livelihood. I am hardly earning any profit since onion and potato prices have gone up.” Surge in prices has also hit sale of onions and potatoes. Vegetable vendor Ramesh Kumar said, “I usually buy a huge stack of potatoes and onions from the wholesale market. Now that their prices have increased, my sales have been affected.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave advisory: Drink enough water,.description: PATNA: With the mercury heading north, patients with heatstroke symptoms like nausea, diarrhoea, dehydration and high fever are making a beeline for hospitals. State Health Society (SHS), a wing of the health department, issued a fresh advisory related to heatwave on Sunday, asking chief medical officers, superintendents and principals of government hospitals, health officers and civil surgeons to make required arrangements for dealing with sunstroke ailments. A draft heatwave action plan was also sent to government hospitals. Health workers have been asked to make people aware about the ways to maintain water level in the body. Hospitals, on the other hand, have been asked to keep adequate quantities of live-saving medicines, IV fluids and ORS to treat patients. “Ensure availability of sufficient water at all health facilities in state. The hospitals should coordinate with the electricity department for uninterrupted power supply,” the advisory issued by SHS executive director Manoj Kumar read. The health department officials have also issued dos and don’ts to tackle prevailing heatwave conditions. Patna Medical College and Hospital superintendent Dr Rajiv Ranjan Sinha said about 50 cases of heatstroke were reported in 15 days. “Five such patients were brought to the hospital on Sunday and three on Saturday in serious conditions. Their condition is, however, stable now,” Dr Sinha added. He said the hospital administration is well prepared to tackle heatstroke cases. “We have set up a five-bed in ICU for heatstroke patients. Intravenous fluids, ORS, electrolytes and other drugs are available in sufficient numbers,” he added. Nalanda Medical College and Hospital superintendent Dr Chandra Shekhar suggested people to drink at least 4-5 litres of water every day. “People should not step out of their homes between 12 noon and 4pm. One should also consume mixture of sugar and salt after adding them with water to prevent dehydration,” Dr Shekhar said. He added no heatstroke case has so far been reported at the NMCH but the doctors have been asked to remain prepared to meet any eventuality. Dr Ranjan Kumar, a city-based general physician, also advised people to drink lots of water and coconut water and going out during afternoon. “Heatstroke patients generally complain of dizziness, loss of appetite and nausea. They should follow healthy diet chart and avoid wearing dark clothes, which absorbs heat easily,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nitish bats for special category status.description: PATNA: Apart from vociferously demanding grant of special category status to Bihar, CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday urged the Centre to discontinue all centrally sponsored schemes (CSS) and make an alternative provision for implementation of the central government’s priority schemes under the name of ‘central sector schemes.’ Speaking at the fifth meeting of the governing council of the NITI Aayog at the Rashtrapati Bhawan in New Delhi in the presence of PM Narendra Modi, Union ministers and chief ministers of many states, Nitish urged the Centre to include non-raiyat farmers, such as sharecroppers and tillers as beneficiaries under the Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana so that the farmers who actually cultivate the land could get the benefit of the scheme. “Under the Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana, financial assistance is given to only those farmers who are landowners. It has been observed in Bihar that many landowners do not cultivate themselves and instead give their land to other farmers under lease or sharecropping. The Bihar government is providing financial assistance to the raiyat and non-raiyat farmers equally in all the important schemes related to agriculture, especially diesel subsidy, agricultural input and Bihar Rajya Fasal Sahayata Yojna. In this perspective, we suggest that non-raiyat farmers should also be included under the Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana,” the CM said. Making a strong pitch for discontinuing the centrally sponsored schemes, Nitish said the existing CSS is putting extra burden on the state’s exchequer due to recent changes in financing ratio between the Centre and the state as well as reduction in the Union government’s contribution in the CSS. “In some of the centrally sponsored schemes, the contribution of the central Government has been reduced to 50%. Due to this change in the financial pattern, Bihar government had to spend Rs 4,500 crore in the financial year 2015-16, Rs 4,900 crore in 2016-17, Rs 15,335 crore in 2017-18 and Rs 21,396 crore in 2018-19 from its own resources in the centrally sponsored schemes. As a result, Bihar is not in a position to meet its priorities of entitlement-based public amenities and other requirements,” Nitish argued. Batting for special category status, Nitish said it would enhance the central government’s share in the centrally sponsored schemes on one hand and provide an opportunity to the states to utilize their resources in other development and welfare schemes on the other. Nitish also requested the Centre that the ceiling of 25% of the State Disaster Response Fund for providing gratuitous relief grant be relaxed and Bihar should be given the funds meant for gratuitous relief grant as per the need of the state as it was available prior to 2015. Patna: No headway in jewellery showroom.description: PATNA: Police have so far not been able to arrest anyone in connection with the loot of jewellery worth around Rs 15 lakh from a showroom in Rupaspur locality of the city in broad daylight on June 12. Incidentally, ADG (headquarters) Kundan Krishnan had visited Rupaspur police station to review law and order just a few hours before the loot. Four armed criminals had decamped after looting all the jewellery kept in the showcases. The criminals were wearing masks to hide their identity. DIG (central range) Rajesh Kumar, said police have identified the criminals and raids were on in Patna and neighbouring districts to arrest them. “The gang members operate from western Patna. SHO of Rupaspur police station Chandra Bhanu said the criminals had not opened fire in course of the loot. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Patna hottest place in country.description: PATNA: Mercury mayhem continued unabated in Bihar with Patna designated as the hottest place in the country on Sunday with the highest maximum temperature of 44.4 degrees C, according to a bulletin issued by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). A respite from the scorching heat is unlikely as IMD has forecast heatwave conditions across the state on Monday as well. Districts in south, central and east Bihar, including Gaya and Bhagalpur among others, are likely to be affected. The Patna Metrological Centre has also issued a heatwave alert for the entire state, except a few districts in north-eastern parts, for the next 48 hours. Heatwave condition is said to prevail when the normal temperature is 40-degree C and above, and the actual temperature continues to be 4.5 notches above the normal for two consecutive days. The maximum temperature recorded in Patna on Saturday was eight notches higher than the respective normal for the day and seven notches higher than the respective normal on Sunday. Patna, in fact, witnessed the highest maximum temperature for the month of June over the past one decade on Saturday with the mercury column recording 45.8 degrees C. The meteorological centre has predicted the maximum temperature to hover in the range of 42- 44 degrees C till June 22. “June and July normally witness the hottest days of the year across the globe as the distance between the Sun and Earth is the least at this time of the year. The solar rays thus penetrate straight to the lowest level of atmosphere. Besides, the hot and dry westerly winds blowing in the region are intensifying the heat,” a senior Patna Met centre official said. Weathermen, however, expect a slight respite from the scorching heat, as the local Met office has issued a forecast of generally cloudy sky with possibility of rain or thunderstorm in the state capital on June 21 and 22. The officials attributed it to pre-monsoon showers. “Excessive heating at this time of the year leads to formation of low- pressure area, which in turn, leads to pre- monsoon thundershowers. Such thundershowers do not last long and subside within 30 minutes or an hour,” said a senior official at Patna meteorological centre. Pre-monsoon showers apart, the southwest monsoon made progress over north-eastern and eastern India on the second consecutive day on Sunday. An all-India daily weather bulletin issued by IMD stated that southwest monsoon further advanced into most parts of northeast India and some parts of north Bengal and Sikkim. However, senior officials at Patna centre claimed that monsoon is unlikely to hit Bihar before June 25, making a delay of nearly a fortnight from its normal onset date in the state. The rain-bearing winds normally enter Bihar through the north- eastern districts of Purnea and Kishanganj around June 10-12. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Widows of 18 CRPF martyrs felicitated.description: PATNA: Widows of 18 CRPF martyrs from Bihar, Jharkhand and Uttar Pradesh were honoured by the Jain International Trade Organisation (JITO), a worldwide organisation of businessmen, industrialists and professionals, at a programme organised in collaboration with the Bihar Chamber of Commerce and Industries (BCCI) and the Patna Jain Samaj on Sunday. A cheque for Rs 3.80 lakh was provided to the family of each martyr by the Ranchi chapter of JITO. Bihar road construction minister Nand Kishore Yadav and industries minister Shyam Rajak handed over the cheques to the widows of martyrs at the programme held at BCCI auditorium. “We should stand with our jawans who sacrifice their lives for the country,” Yadav Yadav. He also thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi for showing the willpower of the nation to avenge the deaths of soldiers. “We should pay tributes and recognise the efforts of our soldiers who safeguard our borders and sacrifice their lives for the nation. However, their deaths cannot be compensated,” Rajak said. CRPF DIG Neeraj Kumar thanked the organisations for supporting the families of CRPF martyrs. “A soldier never wants money as they are well paid by the government. Instead, they look for support and love of the people which encourage them to face death in the line of duty,” he added. Of the 18 martyrs, six were from Bihar. Ratan Kumar Thakur, Pintu Kumar Singh and Sanjay Kumar Sinha from Bhagalpur, Begusarai and Masaurhi, respectively, had lost their lives in the Pulwama terror attack. Md Mojahid Khan from Piro in Bhojpur district had sacrificed his life in a fierce encounter with terrorists in Srinagar. Roshan Kumar and Ajay Kumar Yadav, on the other hand, had attained martyrdom in Maoist attacks in Chhattisgarh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nRavi and Manvi Paswan host son's birth.description: PROUD PARENTS: Ravi and Manvi Paswan recently celebrated the second birthday of their son Panash at a posh hotel in the city. The guest list comprised family members and close friends of the Paswan family. Panash’s grandfather, politico Cheddi Paswan, was spotted welcoming the guests along with his wife Premkali Devi.  EARLY BIRDS: Politico Awadesh Narayan Singh was the early bird at the do, while Dr Sanjeev and Pratyush Katyayan came in a tad late. “We started on time but were caught in a heavy traffic jam,” said Dr Sanjeev. Geetu Jain, who came along with her husband Rohit, and was welcomed with a big hug by Ravi’s sister Shelvi.  MUSIC AND MASTI: The huge Angry Birds-themed cake was quite appreciated by the guests. Soon after the cake-cutting, all the guests gathered on the dance floor and shook a leg on songs like India Waale and Bang Bang. Shelvi, Geetu, Sukriti, Manvi and Ravi had a gala time dancing and refused to budge from the dance floor. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Over 12,000 Bihar doctors to join nation.description: PATNA: More than 12,000 doctors across the state will join the all India 24-hour strike from 6am on Monday called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) to show solidarity with their Bengal counterparts and against attack on two of them in a Kolkata hospital recently. The West Bengal doctors are already on strike demanding fulfilment of their demands, including the arrest of the accused who had grievously injured two doctors and rolling out a stern central law for doctors’ protection. However, keeping the grievous situation due to the increasing number of patients suffering from Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) in several north Bihar districts, the paediatric department at Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) and Sadar hospital at Muzaffarpur have been exempted from the strike. IMA’s Bihar chapter president-elect Dr Bimal Karak said the lack of infrastructure and unavailability of required count of doctors in government hospitals and no action plan on the part of the government leading to more than 90 deaths due to AES in Muzaffarpur till now are additional factors in Bihar for going on strike. Doctors under the aegis of Bihar State Health Services Association have also extended their support to the strike called by IMA, Dr Karak said. In a press release, the State Health Services Association has said the routine work at outpatient departments of hospitals and health centres would be boycotted in support of the IMA’s call. However, doctors would remain on duty in paediatrics department, emergency services and postmortem across the state. Dr Karak said a central team of doctors as well as AIIMS-Patna director Dr P K Singh had clearly said a strong government action plan was required to save the lives from AES in state, which claim so many lives every year. “While the AES has spread to Samastipur and Vaishali too, more than 50 died of heatstroke. The heatstroke cases are the maximum recorded in Bihar since 1966. Amid these situation, there is massive lack of infrastructure as well as count of doctors at government hospitals. This needs to be addressed for improving health sector in the long run,” Dr Karak said. “We have apprised Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan and state health minister Mangal Pandey about the lack of infrastructure,” he said. Karak said after the end of the 24-hour strike, a team of doctors would be sent to Muzaffarpur for assessing the situation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Shops to be shut in 3 districts during d.description: PATNA: Worried over death of 78 people due to heatwave, the state government on Monday ordered closure of all shops and marketing complexes in three south Bihar districts – Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada – from 11am to 5pm. The decision was taken at a high level meeting convened by CM Nitish Kumar to review the government’s preparedness in dealing with heatwave and AES deaths. Briefing media persons about the decisions taken at the meeting, state chief secretary Deepak Kumar said mainly Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada district are badly hit by the unprecedented heatwave. However, the state government has decided to regulate opening time of shops and market complexes in all districts in south Bihar. The chief secretary said the opening and closure timings of shops and marketing complexes would be regulated by the state’s labour resources department (LRD) under the Bihar Shops and Business Establishments Act. To a question, the chief secretary said the LRD would bring out a notification specifying timing and the places to be covered under the government’s latest decision. He, however, clarified that shops and marketing complexes in the state capital would not be affected by Monday’s decision. The chief secretary, who was accompanied by principal secretary (health) Sanjay Kumar, said all necessary arrangements have been made at the government hospitals in heatwave-affected districts to provide medical facilities to people. Sanjay said separate wards and isolation wards have been earmarked in all health facilities in Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada districts. The authorities concerned have been asked to ensure uninterrupted power supply in the three affected districts,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\u200bDoctors' strike paralyzes healthca.description: PATNA: Doctors strike has paralyzed medical and health services in Bihar, where an intense heat wave has claimed 61 lives in the past few days while nearly 100 children have died of suspected acute encephalitis syndrome (AES). The country-wide strike, called by Indian Medical Association in protest against the recent assault on junior doctors at a hospital in West Bengal, has received support from Bihar State Health Services Association. Long queues of hapless patients were seen at PMCH in Patna, the largest hospital in the state, as services at OPDs remained completely suspended, though hospital sources said that emergency services have not been allowed to be affected. Moreover, PMCH Superintendent Rajeev Ranjan said, We have given clear indications that no serious patient should suffer on account of the strike. The doctors are in a government job and they may face stern action if their boycott of work leads to any casualty or any serious patient being refused admission. OPD services are also paralyzed at the SKMCH hospital in Muzaffarpur, where 290 children afflicted with AES have been admitted since June 1, out of whom 80 have died so far. The hospital's superintendent Sunil Shahi, however, said The strike will not have any adverse impact on AES patients since they are admitted to either paediatrics or emergency wards and it had been resolved that the boycott of work by doctors will not affect the functioning of these facilities." State government officials had said that majority of the victims had died due to hypoglycemia, a condition caused by a very low level of blood sugar and electrolyte imbalance. The strike has evoked a similar response in Jehanabad, Bhojpur, Begusarai, Nawada and Supaul districts. Private hospitals and nursing homes have been similarly affected by the strike. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Aqua workouts attract city people.description: Aqua workouts have attracted several fitness enthusiasts of the city. Youngsters are loving this new fitness regime. It is not only a fun workout, but also helps to cure many diseases. People can swim more easily in water. They don’t need to put much stress on their muscles and bones. This makes the exercises easier yet effective. Recently, a few summer camps also introduced aqua aerobics and aqua zumba at their camps. The sessions informed students about its importance and effects. Youngsters also practiced these steps with elan. Working out in water not only builds cardiovascular stamina but also helps relieve joint pain. Surbhi Dubey, a fitness enthusiast, said, “When our body gets immersed in water, it bears around 50% of our weight and therefore it is easy for us to perform our exercises. It relaxes our heart and body completely. The viscosity of water provides more resistance than air. This is the reason why you can exercise at a higher intensity with less impact on the body.” Sharing similar views, Kavya Tripathi, another fitness enthusiast and a college goer, said, “I love working out in water. For me, it is not only interesting but easy too. Of course, summer is the best time for any kind of water activity. It’s fun to be in water. I am happy that some of the fitness experts have come up with this idea and are implementing it for the students.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave red alert in Bihar for two more.description: PATNA: The Patna Meteorological Centre on Monday issued a red alert for heatwave at most places in the state, except some north-eastern districts, for the next 48 hours. Weathermen at the local Met office said red alert has been issued in view of the forecast that more than 75% of the places in the state would witness severe heatwave condition. According to IMD, severe heatwave condition is declared if maximum temperature of a place reaches at least 40 degrees C or more with a departure of more than 6.4 degrees C above normal for the day. The all-India weather bulletin issued by IMD on Monday evening also stated that heatwave in some parts and severe heatwave conditions at isolated places in the state are expected till June 19. The daily heatwave bulletin issued by India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday stated that maximum temperatures were markedly above normal (5.1 degrees C or more) at many places in Bihar. The bulletin further predicted that majority places in Bihar would witness severe heatwave conditions on Tuesday. Meanwhile, some pre- monsoon showers are expected in the state from June 19, but monsoon current is still a few days away. The all-India weather bulletin issued by IMD stated that conditions were becoming favourable for further advance of southwest monsoon into remaining parts of northeast India, sub-Himalayan West Bengal, Sikkim and some parts of Odisha in the next 4 to 5 days. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Garud commandos turn brothers for martyr.description: PATNA: A team of Indian Air Force’s Garud Commando Force visited Badiladih village under Karakat division in Rohtas district to attend the wedding of the third sister of Garud commando Jyoti Prakash Nirala, who had laid down his life in a fierce encounter with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir in 2017. The wedding was solemnised on June 13. The Garud commandos not only attended the wedding of Shashikala, but also extended financial help of Rs 5 lakh to the family and performed the rituals like brothers. Since Nirala was the sole earning member of the family and only brother to four sisters, the family was finding it difficult to arrange money for the wedding. Having realised the hardship of the family, the Garud commandos came forward with the help. In pictures that have gone viral on social media, the commandos can be seen making the bride walk on their palms as per the local tradition. The heart-touching gesture by commandos brought tears to the eyes of those present at the wedding. According to sources, the commandos reached Badiladih village five days before the marriage date and took part in all wedding rituals. Martyr’s father Tej Narayan Singh said the jawans were like his sons. Shashikala, who is doing BEd from Kayamnagar in Ara, got married to Sujit Kumar. The education of Sashikala and other sisters of Nirala is sponsored by Rajya Sabha MP RK Sinha. Nirala was posthumously awarded the Ashok Chakra, India’s highest peacetime military medal, in January last year for exhibiting bravery in fighting the militants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Nityanand Rai meets ailing kids at Muzaf.description: PATNA: Union minister of state for home Nityanand Rai on Saturday said the exact reason for outbreak of acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) disease is still not known. “Researches have been conducted by experts from India as well as Norway to find the cause of this disease and the reason behind fatality of children following high fever. However, no big finding has come out yet,” Rai told media persons at Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital at Muzaffarpur. On his maiden visit to Bihar after being appointed as junior Union home minister in Narendra Modi government, Rai rushed to Muzaffarpur to inspect the hospital and see the condition of ailing kids. “It has been decided that a government team will conduct research on affected families, including their food habits and daily routine,” Rai said. Earlier, Rai, who is also the state president of BJP’s Bihar unit, refused any felicitation by party workers at Patna, and said the party workers would neither organise nor take part in any celebratory ceremony over the next two weeks. “It is a very sad moment for all of us. There were only around two to four deaths due to this disease over the last two years, but the toll has increased steeply this year,” Rai said. He added that the central and state governments along with Muzaffarpur district administration have been working with all seriousness for the treatment of the disease and its prevention. “The entire government machinery is very sensitive about it,” he added. Deliberating on the steps taken for prevention of the disease, Rai said, “Apart from the researches to find out the cause of the disease, numerous steps have been taken to spread awareness among the people about the disease. For instance, advertisements have been issued in newspapers and other forms of mass media, suggesting people not to allow their children to go out in the heat and ensure proper food intake of ailing kids so that their sugar level doesn’t fall.” A two-member delegation of RJD led by party’s state president Ram Chandra Purbey also visited SKMCH on Saturday to take stock of the situation. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

No takers for two PG courses in Patna Un.description: PATNA: Sounds strange, but at least two postgraduate self-financing courses of Patna University (PU) did not have a single aspirant for admission this year. The last date for submitting online application for admission to the two courses — MSc in herbal chemistry and PG diploma in population education — ended on Saturday. Both are supposed to be ‘sunrise’ courses elsewhere, but there are no takers in PU. Some other self-financing courses, too, have failed to attract the minimum desired number of applicants in order to sustain. For instance, PG diploma course in applied criminology has got only one application, while PG diploma in remote sensing and GIS could get only three. PG diploma in financial services and MA in women’s studies also received seven and eight applications respectively. The department heads running these courses would have hard nuts to crack owing to their economic non-viability. As neither the state government nor the university provides any financial assistance, the courses would have to be discontinued, said a senior academic. In regular (conventional) PG courses, the number of applications received for admission to MA, MSc and MCom are 3523, 2803 and 1184 respectively. Since admission to these courses would be made on the basis of marks obtained in the last qualifying examination, the list of candidates selected for admission as per reservation roster would be published on June 20 onward. Meanwhile, PU has opened its online admission portal once again for seeking fresh choice of reservation (10%) from general category students from economically weaker sections for admission to undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Economically weak students from general category can indicate their choice for 10% reservation till June 18. PU had already conducted the centralized entrance test for admission to the Degree Part I honours courses in arts, science and commerce streams, but withheld publication of results due to receipt of a directive from the state education department for implementing the new provision of 10% reservation for the poor general category students from the current session itself. Patna College, Patna Science College, B N College, Magadh Mahila College and Vanijya Mahavidyalaya would announce their lists for admission on June 20 onward. The PG departments would also declare their list at the same time, said PU students’ welfare dean N K Jha. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Acute Encephalitis Syndrome: Nitish Kuma.description: PATNA: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday asked the health department officials to conduct a detailed study on economic condition of the Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES)-affected families and villages in Muzaffarpur district. Chairing a high level meeting convened by him to review the state government’s actions taken in the cases of heatwave in south Bihar and AES deaths in districts of north Bihar, he also asked the officials to conduct a survey on status of malnutrition and cleanliness in the affected families to know whether malnutrition was one of the reasons behind the AES cases. CM also asked the officials to provide free ambulance services to all AES affected children and their parents to bring them to the nearest hospital. “Service of the government-run ambulances are already free-of the cost. If any AES-affected patient reach hospital by hiring private ambulance or vehicle, the government would reimburse the hiring charge. Besides, AES patients are being provided all medicines and other facilities free-of the cost,” state’s chief secretary Deepak Kumar said while beefing media about the decision taken at the CM’s meeting. Kumar said, so far altogether 440 AES patients were admitted at different hospitals in north Bihar. Of them, 129 were discharged after proper treatment. 101 are still under treatment while another 103 could not be saved. He said, compare to previous years, the death rate in the AES cases was low. “In year 2012 and 2013, approximately 34 to 38 per cent AES patients died but this year, so far the mortality rate of such patients is just 26%,” the chief secretary said claiming that the government has made all necessary armaments to tackle the AES case. State’s principal secretary (health) Sanjay Kumar said the standard operating procedures (SOP) for treatment of AES was revised in 2018 as per the feedback from the physicians involved in treatment of such cases. He said as per the SOP, the state government has ensured availability of essential equipment and drugs at 222 primary health centres (PHCs) of 12 affected district for immediate treatment and management of AES cases. He said altogether 445 MBBS doctors from 29 districts were reoriented on the SOP in 2019. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SHO suspended for dereliction of duty.description: PATNA: DIG (central range) Rajesh Kumar on Saturday placed Rajeev Nagar police station SHO Madhusudan Kumar under suspension for not informing senior police officers about an incident of chain stanching from former MLA Pratima Sinha. The incident had taken place around 5.30am on Friday when Pratima was on a morning walk near Ramnagri. The woman had represented Hila assembly constituency while her husband Pankaj Kumar Sinha was also a Congress MLA from Islampur constituency in Nalanda district. Pankaj was shot dead in Patna during morning walk in December 2004. Woman robbed of Rs1 lakh: Two motorcycle-borne criminals snatched Rs 1 lakh from one Amrita Kumari (32) near Ishwari Nagar under the Phulwarisharif police station area here on Saturday. SHO of Phulwarisharif police station Mohammad Kaisar Alam said the woman was returning home after withdrawing the money from State Bank of India (SBI) branch when the incident occurred. “Police have collected footages of CCTV cameras installed in the area to ascertain the identity of the criminals,” the SHO said. Criminal shot at: Three unidentified motorcycle-borne criminals shot at one Upendra Yadav alias Bodiya Gop (45) at Jaganpura under Ram Krishna Nagar police station area in Patna on Saturday. SHO of Ram Krishna Nagar police station Subodh Kumar said Upendra is an accused in the murder of notorious criminal Harendra Gop, who was killed after bombs were hurled in Patna civil court 13 years back. SHO of Ram Krishna Nagar police station Subodh Kumar said Upendra was standing hardly few metres away from his residence when three bike-borne criminals opened fire. Liquor seized: Vaishali district excise superintendent Sunil Kumar Sinha on Friday sent a report to the department after a consignment of liquor manufactured in Bhutan was seized in the district on Thursday night. Seizure of liquor from any foreign country other than Nepal is first of its kind in the state after enforcement of prohibition. Excise inspector Ajeet Kumar said that the liquor was seized from Monamihir village under Belsar outpost in Vaishali district. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Heatwave kills 29 more in Bihar, death t.description: PATNA: Severe heatwave killed 29 more people in Bihar in the past 24 hours, taking the death toll over the past two days to 78, official said on Monday. However unofficially, the heatwave has claimed more than 150 lives in across a dozen districts. Deaths were reported from Aurangabad, Gaya, Nawada and Jamui districts, where temperatures hovered around 45 degrees Celsius on June 15 and 16. According to the state disaster management department website, some 78 deaths had been recorded till 11 am on Monday. Of these, Aurangabad recorded 33 deaths, Gaya 31, Nawada 12 and Jamui 2. Due to the extreme heatwave conditions prevailing in Bihar, district magistrate of Gaya using the provisions under section 144 of Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) issued an order prohibiting people from stepping out of their houses between 11 am to 4 pm. The order from the district magistrate stated that a lot of people have died in the district due to the scorching heatwave and its maximum impact is between 11:00 am to 4:00 pm. "Due to the incidents of deaths caused by the heat wave, there could be an environment of anger and anti-social elements which could further escalate to disruption of law and order in the district. Therefore, the district magistrate of Gaya has issued an order of prohibition using the powers conferred in Section 144 of the CrPC," said an official order from the public relations branch of district magistrate. Additional health director of Magadh range Dr Vijay Kumar said that nearly 150 people had been admitted in government-run hospitals in Gaya, Aurangabad and Nawada, while dozens were being treated at primary health centres in the three districts. The state health department on Monday sent a team of doctors to the worst-hit Aurangabad and Gaya districts. Chief minister Nitish Kumar has expressed grief over the deaths and announced a compensation of Rs 4 lakh to the kin of the victims. The government has also issued a heat alert in the wake of the rising death toll and advised people to take care while going outside during day time. In Video:After over 40 deaths in Bihar’s Gaya, 5 more die in Nalanda due to heat strokeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nYoungsters organise a party at a disc.description: A party was recently organised by a group of youngsters at a city disc to mark the start of the holiday season.  Aditya, one of the organisers, told us, “The idea was to provide a change to the college students who have just got free from exams. I hope the party will be a fun event for people who want to dance and enjoy.” The girls donned pretty dresses and skirts at the part, while the boys were spotted in casual attire. Janvi looked elegant in her black dress, along with Sneha, who was dressed in a floral frock.ABHI TOH PARTY SHURU HUI HAI:  DJ Zeeshan set the mood for the party by belting out popular dance numbers. However, it wasn’t just contemporary Bollywood songs that ruled the roost. The youngsters also had fun dancing to songs from the 90s like Ole Ole, My Name is Lakhan and Main Khiladi Tu Anari. — Swati.Savarn@timesgroup.com Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPragyotsav, the annual cultural fest o.description: MASTI KI PAATHSHALA: Pragyotsav, the annual cultural fest of Patna Women’s College, was recently organised to commemorate the completion of 75 years of the college. The three-day event on the college campus turned out to be a fun affair with activities like creative writing, skit, rangoli-making, quiz, singing and dance competition, and a lot more.  Sonam Jha, an ex student of the college, said, “I’m really glad to be a part of this college and I feel privileged for getting an opportunity to perform on the stage during the college fest.” The boys particularly had a gala time because this was the first time that they were participating in an event of Patna Women’s College. “I’m so glad to participate in this fest. This is like a dream come true, participating in the event at a girl’s college,” said Amir.  TIME FOR SOME FUN: The last day of the fest saw some energetic dance performances. The first act was by Sonam Jha and Naina Singh on the song Badtameez Dil, followed by a group dance by Vinni and her team. Aisha and her group too enthralled the crowd with their dance performance. The crowd too was in the mood for some masti, as they danced in the college grounds during the performance. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Prisons department for reforms in Probat.description: PATNA: Inspector general (prisons and correctional services) Mithilesh Mishra on Saturday said the prisons department would send a draft to Bureau of Police Research and Development (BPRD), suggesting reforms in the probation system which was introduced in the country 60 years back. Mishra was speaking at the inaugural session of the two-day national seminar on ‘Probation: Relevancy, opportunity and challenges’, which was inaugurated by law minister Narendra Narayan Yadav on the premises of Bihar Institute of Correctional Administration (BICA) at Hajipur in Vaishali district on Saturday. The seminar is being attended by more than 20 probation officers from Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand, Delhi and some other states. Altogether 74 probation officers and superintendents of eight central jails in Bihar are also attending the seminar. Mishra laid emphasis on strengthening the probation system to make it more effective so that that the first-time offenders committing petty offences can be stopped from turning into repeated offenders. He also emphasised on the effective use of probation officers in the state. Courts depend on confidential report of probation officers which is prepared on the basis of offender’s locality, environment around him, family and few other factors for allowing such offenders to settle back instead of throwing them behind bars. The Centre had rolled out Probation of Offenders Act, 1958 so that first-time offenders could be saved from becoming repeated offenders. The Bihar government had brought Probation of Offenders Rules in 1958. The participants were also told about the Patna high court judgment delivered in Upendra Nath Chaudhary case in 2007 in which the court had ruled that lower courts are bound to seriously consider report of probation officers for rehabilitating first-time offenders. The provision in the Act states that a first-time offender between age group of 18 and 21 years, who had committed any petty crime attracting imprisonment of less than seven years, is brought back into the mainstream of the society instead of throwing them behind bars and turning them into habitual offenders. The state currently has working strength of 107 probation officers against the sanctioned strength of 145. The officers belong to Bihar Probation Service. It is on the basis of a probation officer’s report that an inmate is released on parole or his sentence is remitted. RJD chief Lalu Prasad had come out of Ranchi jail on parole to attend his elder son Tej Pratap Yadav’s wedding on the basis of a report of probation officer of state government submitted before a CBI court in Ranchi.
