Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Nishant Saraf suspected his wife\u2019s.description: PATNA: The strained relation between businessman Nishant Saraf and his wife Alka over the alleged presence of a third person in her life resulted in the brutal killing of the two along with their minor daughter in their bedroom at Kidwaipuri residence in the state capital on June 11, police sources said. Nishant had shot dead his wife and daughter Ananya in their sleep before killing himself. He had also shot at his four-year-old son Ishant, who is undergoing treatment in a private hospital. When asked over phone on Sunday, DIG (central range) Rajesh Kumar also said Nishant had been depressed for more than one year mainly due to his wife after which he committed suicide after killing Alka and their daughter. DIG Kumar said Alka used to talk to someone else for a long time and that strained her relationship with Nishant. “It is due to this reason that she wanted divorce from her husband,” DIG told TOI, adding further investigation were on. The bodies of Nishant, Alka and Ananya were found on their bed inside their bedroom in their lavish three-storey house at Kidwaipuri under the Kotwali police station area. The room was locked from inside and it was opened through a master key by other family members after the couple along with their kids had not come out for breakfast. All the four had bullet injuries in their heads. Police had said Nishant shot dead Alka and Ananya in their sleep before killing himself by a licensed pistol. Police had also recovered two suicide notes written by Nishant and a divorce paper signed by Alka from their room. The couple had returned from Europe tour hardly four days before the incident. Meanwhile, police are awaiting forensic report of the couple’s cellphones along with toxicology report as froth was coming out of Ananya’s mouth. DSP (law and order) Rakesh Kumar said the toxicology report would clear if she was administered any kind of drug before killing or not. Patna police might also address a press conference on Monday to clear the air over the case. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ashok Rajpath: Where booksellers do bris.description: PATNA: Can you imagine books selling like vegetables? And, that too, when more and more youths are turning internet-savvy and colleges as well as university departments getting e-libraries along with e-books for the benefit of students? If not, visit Ashok Rajpath around the Patna University (PU) campus and see how books of all sorts are selling on the pavement. More than 500 bookstalls line the southern pavement of Ashok Rajpath, right from Patna College to Science College, a distance of hardly 200 metres, doing brisk business. They virtually occupy the entire sidewalk of the busy thoroughfare and sell books right from morning to late evening every day. Thousands of people, mostly students, walk past these book stalls every day, jostling against one another and purchasing books of their choice. Even though some of these book stalls have been at the place for the last several decades and the book sellers are second or even third generation businessmen, the number of book stalls has grown manifold in recent years. Most of these stalls sell books meant for competitive examinations for admission to medical and engineering courses and jobs in various public sector or private sector organisations. Help books and guides for civil services examinations can be found in plenty, said Ravindra, an MA economics student of PU. The nature of selling at these stalls is highly non-intrusive. Unlike other roadside stalls selling various consumer items, there is no shouting or chanting or thrusting wares at potential customers’ faces. They sit patiently waiting for the customer to finish checking out the books – sometime walking from one end of the sidewalk to the other – and making up their minds. The deal is sealed in a couple of minutes. This quiet nature, however, does not stop slinky browsers who copy designs and notes from these books, with no intentions of buying them, from being shooed away vigorously. Bargaining is also the in-thing at these stalls as students would invariably pay less than the printed price of the books. Most of these sellers offer 20 to 30% discount on competitive books, said another PG history department student Satyarthi. Those who want to buy books at more cheaper rates visit the old book market of the city located near the Gandhi Maidan. One can easily get any book, from course books to novels of all ages, from this market. This is the best place to be as far as textbooks are concerned. Books for any subject, in any university in the country, can be found here at much cheaper rates. However, there is little guarantee of books being the original or a pirated version. “We get our stuff from Delhi and Calcutta. As far as the old books are concerned, they are collected over the years. Some have been bought too. People come to our stalls from Punjab, Delhi and even the south. We get foreign customers also,” said book seller Chandrama Singh. It is, however, interesting to note that while the business of these roadside book stalls is growing day by day, the traditional book shops of the city are not finding enough customers these days. While some shops located on Ashok Rajpath have already been closed, others are switching over to other businesses. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Sadhvi Pragya.description: NEW DELHI: BJP MP from Bhopal Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur created a controversy on the first day of 17th Lok Sabha on Monday when she suffixed the name of her spiritual guru with hers while taking oath, drawing objections from the opposition. Amid protests and shoutings, Thakur said that it was her full name and she had already mentioned it in the form she had filled for oath taking. The mention of Swami Purna Chetnanand Avdheshanand Giri as suffix to her name evoked sharp reaction from the opposition members who said that such a thing was not permitted. She insisted that the suffix was part of her full name, resulting in an uproar from opposition and slogan shouting in her favour from the ruling benches. Following the din, Pro-tem Speaker Virendra Kumar asked the Lok Sabha secretary general about Pragya's full name. Amid noise and objections, Kumar ruled that only the name written in her election certificate issued by the returning officer would go on record. Thakur, the Malegaon blast accused, took oath in Sanskrit and ended it with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan. Thakur defeated Congress stalwart Digvijay Singh to enter the Lok Sabha for the first time. Later, BJP members continued to raise 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans, teasing the opposition. They started raising slogan after oath taking by every BJP member. After Ganjendra Umarao Singh Patel (BJP) completed his oath with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai', N K Premchandran (RSP) urged the Pro tem Speaker to maintain the prescribed format of the oath. The Pro tem speaker ruled that the members stick to the format provided. After this, the members of BJP started adding 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' after end of every oath. Some of the prominent names who took oath from Madhya Pradesh included K P Yadav who defeated Jyotiraditya Scindia, Rakesh Singh, Ramakant Bhargava and Nakul Nath. Indore MP Shankar Lalwani took oath in Sindhi. In Video:Lok Sabha: Sadhvi Pragya made to take oath againDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Railways completes RRI work at Danapur s.description: PATNA: Work on the route relay interlocking (RRI) system, which began at Danapur station under the East Central Railway (ECR) on June 8, was completed on Monday. According to Danapur divisional railway manager (DRM) Ranjan Prakash Thakur, as many as 1,000 railway staff from signalling, traffic and engineering departments worked round the clock to complete the work in record time. “The Danapur yard, which had been functioning through a manual system for almost 60 years, has now been modernized. The new RRI system will be tested till June 19 to ensure that it is snag-free. However, normal traffic movement on the Patna-Danapur-Buxar-Pt Deendayal Upadhyay Junction route will be restored from June 20,” Thakur said. Danapur is the third station, after Jhajha and Patna Junction in the Danapur division, which is equipped with RRI system. Thakur told this newspaper, “The railways completed this project at a cost of Rs 50 crore. The biggest advantage of the RRI system is that it will ensure foolproof safety on the tracks and avert head-on collisions of trains. Besides, there will not be chances of signal failure and detention of trains at outer signals. This will improve the punctuality of passenger trains.” The railways has also built a separate RRI cabin at the Danapur station from where movement of passenger and goods trains can be controlled safely. Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Encephalitis toll rises to 83; Union hea.description: PATNA: The suspected acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) toll at two hospitals in Muzaffarpur went up to 83 till 9am on Sunday even as the state health department confirmed that Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan would visit Muzaffarpur on Sunday to take stock of the situation. As per the medical bulletin, 69 children have died at Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital (SKMCH) and 14 at Kejriwal Matrisadan in Muzaffarpur till 9am on Sunday. The civil surgeon said altogether 316 suspected AES cases have been recorded since January this year – 230 at SKMCH and 96 at Kejriwal Matrisadan. Of the 93 patients undergoing treatment at the two hospitals currently – 74 at SKMCH and 19 at Kejriwal Matridan – the condition of 12 is stated to be critical. The civil surgeon said 79 patients have so far been discharged from the SKMCH and 21 from Kejriwal Matrisadan. “We have taken all precautionary measures to contain the spread of the disease,” Dr Singh told this newspaper over the phone from Muzaffarpur. The report of civil surgeon was also sent to the health department. Earlier in the day, principal secretary of health department Sanjay Kumar visited Muzaffarpur and took stock of the situation. Kumar held a meeting with the civil surgeon, superintendent of the SKMCH and officials of the district administration to get feedback on treatment of the patients. Records available at the SKMCH revealed that the majority of suspected AES cases have been reported from Muzaffarpur, Sheohar, Vaishali and East Champaran districts. Kanti, Musahari, Katra, Minapur and Muraul blocks in Muzaffarpur district have been identified as most vulnerable for the suspected AES cases. The district administration has intensified awareness campaign in the worst-hit villages. A senior health department official said other districts have also been alerted. In 2014, Dr Harsh Vardan had visited Muzaffarpur after the disease gained alarming proportions. A standard operating system (SOP) was prepared for the treatment of the patients on the recommendation of the medical experts in 2013. The SOP was revised in 2018, sources in the health department said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PMC: 1 lakh twin bins to segregate waste.description: PATNA: As many as one lakh twin bins, used for the segregation of dry and wet wastes, will be distributed among households in the city within a month. This was announced by Patna municipal commissioner Anupam Kumar Suman at a press conference here on Saturday. Before addressing mediapersons, he attended a review meeting chaired by state urban development and housing department (UDHD) minister Suresh Kumar Sharma with officials of the Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC). The status of ongoing projects on cleanliness, water supply, holding tax, housing, vending zones and recreational zones as well as many new proposals were discussed at the meet. “The PMC has decided to distribute one lakh twin bins in New Capital, Kankerbagh, Bankipore, Pataliputra, Azimabad and Patna City circles for segregation of garbage,” Suman said and added people would be able to pay the garbage collectors through the Paytm wallet soon. The PMC commissioner also announced that two vending zones on Boring Canal Road and in Kadamkuan vegetable market area would be ready by August. He said, “We have already distributed 2,100 vendor identification cards and formed a town vending committee. At least 2,500 more ID cards will be distributed by next month.” Deliberating on the development works at Adalatganj Talab under the Patna Smart City project, he said, “Workers have already cleaned the water of the pond. A pathway, music fountain and open theatre will be ready before August 15.” As far as the affordable housing project is concerned, Suman said the PMC had given a proposal to the UDHD to buy land from the state government at the outskirts of Patna. Bihar encephalitis deaths: Complaint cas.description: PATNA: Social activist Tamanna Hashmi filed a complaint case against Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan and state health minister Mangal Pandey in a Muzaffarpur court on Monday, charging them with negligence that led to death of 97 children due to suspected acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) in Muzaffarpur and its adjoining districts in the past fortnight. The court of chief judicial magistrate of Muzaffarpur has fixed June 24 as the next date of hearing in the case. The complaint petition said both Dr Harsh Vardhan and Mangal Pandey failed to discharge their duties to contain the disease. Though the two ministers visited Muzaffarpur and took stock of the situation, the death of the children below the age of 10 years continued unabated. The petition alleged that no concrete step was taken by the health department to create awareness and sensitise people in the AES affected areas. The two ministers have been booked under Sections 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 308 (culpable homicide) and 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace) of the IPC. If convicted under Section 504 of IPC, the accused is liable for punishment for two years or fine or both. The accused is liable for punishment for a term of three years after being convicted under Section 308 of IPC and one year under Section 323 of IPC. On being contacted, Hashmi alleged that majority of children belonging to the lower strata of society died due to negligence and lack of infrastructure in the government hospitals. The Union health minister accompanied by his junior minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey and state health minister Mangal Pandey had visited the Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital on Sunday and held a high level meeting with the doctors and the officials of the health department to review arrangements for the treatment of the ailing children. “We have no information about any complaint lodged by anybody in the court as we have not received any notice,” said a senior official of the state health department. Encephalitis death toll mounts to 83 in.description: MUZAFFARPUR: With death of 10 more children, the toll mounted to 83 on Sunday morning due to suspected Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) that has gripped Muzaffarpur and the adjoining districts in Bihar. Most of the casualties are between the age group of 1-10. According to the doctors, the deaths due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) are being caused due to excessive heat and humidity. Locally, this fever is being called 'Chamki and Bukhar' (convulsion and high fever). Health experts are of the opinion that unless and until rainfall takes place, the situation will only aggravate in days to come. Confirming the deaths of the kids, district magistrate Alok Ranjan Ghosh said that the total number of patients with AES-like symptoms have crossed the barrier of 350 as 30 more children were admitted till 9am on Sunday. “Seven kids have died of the disease at Sri Krishna Medical College, while 3 succumbed to it at Kejriwal Matri Sadan (KMS). 108 children have still been going under treatment, 85 at SKMCH and 23 at KMS each. Every possible treatment is being given to the children,” he said. Meanwhile, chief minister Nitish Kumar has announced an ex-gratia of Rs 4 lakh each to families of the children, fallen prey of this deadly disease, the reasons of which are still unknown to the experts and medical science even after it has consumed more than 5,000 lives of innocent kids in last two and half decades. The CM has also given directions to health department, district administration and the doctors to take necessary measures to fight the disease. Meanwhile, Union health minister Dr Harsh Vardhan and junior health minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey reached Muzaffarpur on Sunday to assess the condition. He visited the SKMCH and KMS to take stock of the situation. He also talked to the doctors treating the kids. He also held a meeting with the district administration as well as health officials from district and state headquarter till filing of the reports. Muzaffarpur: Acute Encephalitis Syndrome.description: MUZAFFARPUR: With 10 more deaths on Monday, the toll due to Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (AES) has risen to 103 in Muzaffarpur. The figures were reported from two hospitals of the district - Sri Krishna Medical College and Hospital and Kejriwal Matri Sadan till 4pm. Issuing the medical bulletin, district magistrate Alok Ranjan Ghosh said that 98 new kids, inflicted with suspected AES were admitted in these two hospitals. “With these admissions, the total number of affected and admitted children has gone up to 440 since June 1 this year alone. Though, 130 kids have been discharged from the hospital after getting well; 150 children are still undergoing treatment at these two medical institutions of the district. The condition of 24 children are critical and they have been kept on ventilators,” he said adding that 40 more kids are ready to be discharged as they have been declared fit by the doctors. Meanwhile, a senior paediatrician Dr Arun Shah said that only awareness programme would not help in preventing the deaths of children. “I have been observing the cases of AES for last two and half decades. I have minutely studied the cases of the deaths. I have found that these children, either fallen prey of the disease or have been going treatment, are affected with lack of sugar in their body. This is called hypoglycaemia in medical term. The affected children are either suffering from another disease or are malnourished. These kids are from below poverty line and have been fed very poorly. So, they don't have stock of glucose in their body to release in emergency condition,” he said. He added that AES affects the central nervous system, mostly in children and young adults. It starts with high fever, then hampers neurological functions causing mental disorientation, seizure, confusion, delirium, coma. However, a report by noted paediatrician of CMC Vellor Dr T Jacob John, published in Current Science mentioned that the clinical features in patients were stereo-type. “Sudden onset without prodromal phase, inconsistent presence of fever, brain edema, absence of inflammatory cell response in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and hypoglycemia. These clinical features and preliminary epidemiological findings of tightly restricted seasonality and geographic distribution as well as sparing of children below 2 years support the diagnosis of acute non-infectious encephalopathy as against viral encephalitis. Children are quite well until evening, but early next morning they are found seriously ill with brain function derangement and seizures. Under-nutrition (short and underweight for age) has been observed as a consistent associated fact,” mentioned the report. Upload Part III marks till Tuesday, Patn.description: PATNA: Even as the deadline for online submission of application forms for admission to different postgraduate (PG) courses of Patna University (PU) ended on Saturday, it has allowed some applicants to upload their graduation marks till June 18. According to a notification issued by PU, students, who had not been able to submit their Degree Part III examination marks due to delayed publication of results, can now do so by June 18. “The list of candidates selected for admission to various PG courses will be published only after that,” said PU students’ welfare dean N K Jha. The Degree Part III results of several students were kept pending as they had not cleared their Part II exams. “The results of BSc and BCom Part II exams were published on Saturday and those of BA students will be out soon. Students can also be provided with their confidential marks on demand,” Jha told this reporter. Meanwhile, PU has opened its online admission portal once again for seeking fresh choice of reservation (10%) from general category students for admission to undergraduate and postgraduate courses. Economically weak students from general category can indicate their choice for 10% reservation till June 18. PU had already conducted the centralized entrance test for admission of students to the Degree Part I courses in arts, science and commerce streams, but withheld publication of results due to last-minute receipt of a directive from the state education department for implementing the new provision of 10% reservation for general category students from the current session. “Patna College, Patna Science College, B N College, Magadh Mahila College and Vanijya Mahavidyalaya will announce the list of selected students from June 20 onwards. The PG departments will also declare their lists at the same time,” said PU sources. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors\u2019 strike hits OPD services i.description: PATNA: Most government hospitals wore a deserted look and the OPDs too remained closed as over 12,000 doctors joined the nationwide strike called by the Indian Medical Association across the state on Monday. However, emergency services were exempted from the purview of the strike. The strike was called to protest frequent attacks on doctors across the country. Reena Devi (35), a resident of Kankerbagh in the city, was seething with anger as she had to run from pillar to post for the treatment of her 13-year-old daughter Rita, who was suffering from high fever. The main entrance gate of the Nalanda Medical College and Hospital (NMCH), where she was waiting with her daughter, was closed due to the doctors’ strike. “Yahan garibon ka koi sudh lene wala nahi hai (nobody is here to take care of the poor),” a visibly angry Reena said. Like Reena, many from the lower strata of society had to suffer a lot due to the doctors’ agitation in solidarity with their West Bengal counterparts on Monday. One Rohan Kumar (25), who was hit by sunstroke, too had to return from the NMCH due to the agitation. Superintendent of Patna Medical College and Hospital (PMCH) Dr Rajiv Ranjan said the emergency wing of the hospital functioned as usual. The scene at Indira Gandhi Institute of Medical Sciences (AIGMS) was more heart rendering where Janki Devi (35), a resident of Chhapra in Saran district, was wreathing in pain. “I am suffering from arthritis. It’s very painful. I had an appointment with the doctor but he is not present in the hospital. The officials told me that the doctors are on strike and it will continue for a few more days,” she told this newspaper. Similarly, 65-year-old Nand Kishore Mandal, a resident of Madhepura, had to return to his native village as the officials at the premier hospital told him that the functioning had been hampered due to the doctors’ agitation. “Come next time as the doctors are on indefinite strike,” Mandal was told by one of employees of the IGIMS. He too had problem in one of his legs. Dr Anurag Kumar, casualty medical officer at emergency ward of IGIMS said, “We have supported the nationwide strike called by the IMA against frequent attacks on doctors across the country. However, the emergency services were not hampered due to the strike.” Anjit Kumar, a resident of Imamganj in Gaya district, whose cousin was admitted to the IGIMS, corroborated Dr Anurag’s claim. “Emergency services at the hospital were satisfactory. Immediate attention was given to the critical patients,” he said. Around 12,000 doctors joined the strike on the call of the Indian Medical Association across the state on Monday. (With inputs from Pushkar Ranjan and Mariya Khan)Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhagalpur: 1 killed over lottery money r.description: BHAGALPUR: Dispute in sharing the prize money of a lottery ticket purchased jointly by two friends resulted in the killing of one of them by the other, said Naugachia police sources on Monday. Md Niyaz Mansoori (28), was killed by his friend Phulo Rai on Friday. The body of the deceased, which was buried under heaps of sand in a house which was under construction, was recovered by the police on Sunday. Police sources said that Niyaz, a resident of Mumtaj mohalla in Naugachia and Phulo, a resident of Naugachia Bazaar locality, had purchased a lottery ticket by pooling money nearly three months ago. They won a prize money of Rs 1 lakh. Niyaz collected the prize money from the lottery company as the ticket was in his possession. But instead of sharing the prize money in equal amount with Phulo (the accused), he paid only Rs 30,000 to the latter and was trying to avoid him for the last two months. Naugachia SP Nidhi Rani said Naugachia PS SHO Lal Bahadur Singh has been suspended following investigation about the charges levelled by the family of the victim. Bihar heatwave death toll surges to 61.description: PATNA/NAWADA/AURANGABAD: Heat wave in Bihar claimed 17 more lives on Sunday taking the death toll 61. The deaths were reported from three districts in the Magadh division —Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada — over the past 24 hours. Altogether 44 deaths were recorded till 12am on Saturday. Aurangabad reported the highest number of deaths at 30 followed by 20 in Gaya and 11 in Nawada. The figures were confirmed by state disaster management department principal secretary Pratyaya Amrit. “Postmortem reports in most cases have confirmed heat wave as the cause of death. We are keeping a close watch on the situation. We have also issued an advisory to all distract magistrates to take preventive steps as well as relief measures in the light of prevailing heat wave conditions,” Pratyaya told TOI on Sunday. In Aurangabad, the death toll went up to 30 with four more deaths reported on Sunday. Aurangabad deputy development commissioner Ghanshyam Meena, who is also officiating as DM, confirmed the 30 deaths on Sunday and admitted that five seriously ill patients were referred to the Narayani Medical College in neighbouring Rohtas district. In another indication that death count may rise, Aurangabad civil surgeon Surendra Prasad said relatives of some of the deceased refused to allow doctors to conduct autopsy. “Some of the patients couldn’t be registered due to the chaos in the hospital premises. They left with the bodies of their relatives without post-mortem examination,” he told reporters in Aurangabad. However, unconfirmed reports put the death toll at 33 in Aurangabad district alone even as a newly built ICU and a well-equipped room being used as de-addiction centre were thrown open to accommodate new patients at the Aurangabad sadar hospital. Gaya DM Abhishek Singh said on Sunday that most of the heatstroke victims were either brought dead or succumbed during treatment at the Anugrah Narayan Magadh Medical College and Hospital (ANMMCH), Gaya. Currently 14 people are under treatment at the hospital, Singh added. Majority of the deceased were those above 60, who couldn’t bear the heatwave that swept through southwest Bihar on Saturday, Singh told this newspaper over phone on Sunday. Four doctors from Patna have been sent to ANMMCH to assist with the rush of patients, while primary health centres have been told to keep aside 50% of their beds for sunstroke victims. Senior district officials have been told to camp at the hospital till the situation returned to normal. In Nawada district, three died at the sadar hospital soon after being admitted on Saturday evening, while the rest died during treatment. Nawada DM Kaushal Kishore said 14 people are undergoing treatment at the government hospital at Pawapuri. Health experts said heatstroke occurs when the part of the brain, which regulates body temperature, starts malfunctioning due to excessive heat. The daily heatwave bulletin issued by India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Sunday evening stated that maximum temperatures were markedly above normal (5.1 degrees C or more) at many places over Bihar. The state also witnessed severe heatwave conditions on Sunday. Nawada civil surgeon Srinath Prasad told TOI that most patients were elderly people. “Most of the deceased were in the age group of 70-85 years and belonged to poor as well as middle-income families. They arrived with complaints of sudden high fever, body ache and unconsciousness,” he said. Authorities conceded their failures in spreading awareness in the state. “We concede that the unprecedented heatwave conditions this year...reveals the inadequacy of our awareness campaigns and limitations of our reach to the grassroots. We urge all stakeholders, including district administrations to disseminate awareness messages in every village and ward and take actions as specified under Heat Action Plan of the state government,” Bihar State Disaster Management Authority vice-chairman Vyasji said. He added: “It’s a matter of grave concern for all of disaster management practitioners, BSDMA and district administration that so many precious lives have been lost due to heatwave conditions in Aurangabad, Gaya and Nawada. This is more painful that the deaths have occurred in so many numbers despite our Heat Action Plan shared with all departments and districts recently as well as capacity building of the panchayat representatives over the last one year.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bihar: Schools to remain closed till Jun.description: PATNA: The government issued an order on Monday to all district magistrates (DM) and education officers, asking them to shut government and private schools as well as coaching institutes across the state till June 22 due to the prevailing heatwave. While state project director of Bihar Education Project Council Sanjay Singh issued a notification regarding closure of government and government-aided schools across the state till June 22, state chief secretary Deepak Kumar ordered closure of even private schools and coaching institutes till Saturday. Later in the evening, Patna DM Kumar Ravi asked all government and private schools in the district to extend their summer vacations till June 22. Summer holidays in all schools had been extended for seven days till June 19, almost a week ago due to scorching heat. Now, teachers expect a hectic schedule after schools reopen. They are, therefore, making strategies to cover the syllabi on time before the arrival of exams. St Michael’s High School principal Father Edison J Armstrong told this newspaper, “After the school reopens, we will focus more on academics than extracurricular activities. Our teachers will make sure that syllabi of classes X and XII are completed on time.” Notre Dame Academy teacher Kalpana Sinha, who teaches Class XII students, agreed that an extended summer vacation would affect academics. She said, “We are likely to convert Saturdays into full working days for completing the syllabi on time.” Although summer vacations are fun, a third extension has started worrying students as well. Ishan International School’s Class XI student Apoorva hailed the government’s decision as “the hot weather is unbearable” and can make them sick. “We, however, have less time to complete the syllabi. All we can depend on is self-study at home for now,” he said. Apoorva’s mother Sarita Jha shared similar concerns, saying, “Anyone will fall sick. Studies will definitely be hampered, but health comes first.” Shivam Convent student Shubham Shekher said, “I have to prepare for my Class XII and other competitive exams. Extended vacations will affect my studies.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. \nBlind Fold performs at a party hosted.description: A restaurant in the city recently organised a musical evening for its patrons on the occasion of its second anniversary. Hosts Romie and Rupa were seen welcoming the guests, which comprised the creme-de-la-creme of the city.  Rock band Blind Fold performed live on the occasion, and the guests enjoyed the music and the sumptuous food. RJ Anjali, looking chic in her cat eye glasses, was spotted having a good time at the do along with her colleagues. STEALING THE SHOW: Songs like Intehan Ho Gayi Intezaar Ki,Chahoon Main Ya Na and Kabhi Jo Baadal Barse were among the most requested songs at the do. The guests enjoyed the dance performance by Tanushree Roy. Yashaswi Singh’s rendition of the song Khamoshiyaan mesmerised everyone, with the crowd demanding an encore.
